message_1: In a sports tournament, there are 10 teams. If each team plays against every other team exactly once, how many total matches will be played?
message_2:
In a sports tournament with 10 teams, where each team plays against every other team exactly once, we can use the formula for combinations to find the total number of matches played. The formula for combinations is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of teams, k is the number of teams in each match (which is 2 in this case), and ! denotes the factorial.

In this case, n = 10 and k = 2. So, we have:

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!(10-2)!)

C(10, 2) = 10! / (2!8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 × 9 × 8!)/(2 × 8!)

C(10, 2) = (10 × 9)/(2)

C(10, 2) = 90/2

C(10, 2) = 45

So, there will be a total of 45 matches played in the tournament.
